intro: Ageratina cupressorum, commonly known as the Mexican buttonweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its small, white to pale blue flowers are arranged in dense clusters, giving it a button-like appearance. Ageratina cupressorum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
